comment.shortText: The [[Router]]'s current base URL, typically based on the [[Router.currentInstruction]].
The currently active navigation instruction.
True if the [[Router]] has been configured.
True if the [[Router]] is currently processing a navigation.

Registers a new route with the router.

comment.text: The [[RouteConfig]].
The [[NavModel]] to use for the route. May be omitted for single-pattern routes.

comment.shortText: Configures the router.

comment.text: The [[RouterConfiguration]] or a callback that takes a [[RouterConfiguration]].

comment.shortText: Creates a child router of the current router.

comment.text: The [[Container]] to provide to the child router. Uses the current [[Router]]'s [[Container]] if unspecified.

comment.shortText: Creates a [[NavModel]] for the specified route config.

comment.text: The route config.

comment.returns: A string containing the generated URL fragment.

comment.shortText: Register a handler to use when the incoming URL fragment doesn't match any registered routes.

comment.text: The name of the route to check.

comment.text: The name of the route to check.

comment.shortText: Navigates to a new location.

comment.text: The URL fragment to use as the navigation destination.

comment.shortText: Navigates back to the most recent location in history.

Navigates to a new location corresponding to the route and params specified. Equivallent to [[Router.generate]] followed
by [[Router.navigate]].

comment.text: The name of the route to use when generating the navigation location.
The route parameters to be used when populating the route pattern.
The navigation options.

comment.shortText: Updates the document title using the current navigation instruction.
Class for storing and interacting with a route's navigation settings.
The route config.
This nav item's absolute href.
True if this nav item is currently active.
This nav item's relative href.
Data attached to the route at configuration time.
The title.

Sets the route's title and updates document.title.
 If the a navigation is in progress, the change will be applied
 to document.title when the navigation completes.

comment.text: The new title.

comment.shortText: Used during the activation lifecycle to cause a redirect.
Called by the navigation pipeline to navigate.

comment.text: a router which should redirect

The name of the viewPort. 'default' if unspecified.

comment.shortText: Resets the Router to its original unconfigured state.
Updates the document title using the current navigation instruction.
Class used to configure a [[Router]] instance.
Adds a step to be run during the [[Router]]'s navigation pipeline.

comment.text: The name of the pipeline slot to insert the step into.
The pipeline step.

comment.shortText: Applies the current configuration to the specified [[Router]].

comment.text: The [[Router]] to apply the configuration to.

comment.shortText: Maps one or more routes to be registered with the router.

comment.text: The [[RouteConfig]] to map, or an array of [[RouteConfig]] to map.

comment.shortText: Maps a single route to be registered with the router.
Registers an unknown route handler to be run when the URL fragment doesn't match any registered routes.

comment.text:
A string containing a moduleId to load, or a [[RouteConfig]], or a function that takes the
 [[NavigationInstruction]] and selects a moduleId to load.

comment.shortText: A configuration object that describes a route.

The URL fragment to use in nav models. If unspecified, the [[RouteConfig.route]] will be used.
However, if the [[RouteConfig.route]] contains dynamic segments, this property must be specified.
The moduleId of the view model that should be activated for this route.

A unique name for the route that may be used to identify the route when generating URL fragments.
Required when this route should support URL generation, such as with [[Router.generate]] or
the route-href custom attribute.

When specified, this route will be included in the [[Router.navigation]] nav model. Useful for
dynamically generating menus or other navigation elements. When a number is specified, that value
will be used as a sort order.
A URL fragment to redirect to when this route is matched.
The route pattern to match against incoming URL fragments, or an array of patterns.
The document title to set when this route is active.

The view ports to target when activating this route. If unspecified, the target moduleId is loaded
into the default viewPort (the viewPort with name 'default'). The viewPorts object should have keys
whose property names correspond to names used by <router-view> elements. The values should be objects
specifying the moduleId to load into that viewPort.

Determines if the provided object is a navigation command.
A navigation command is anything with a navigate method.

comment.text: The item to check.
